text:
I had a quick look at the first two parts. The first one is a good overview of the differences between Jupyter and Observable. The second one is a nice example for data analysis/visualization.
If the goal is to get Python/Jupyter users interested in Observable, I'd say the big missing part is helping people with finding their way around the JavaScript ecosystem. Your second notebook does that in a way, but only for a very narrow application range.

Example: this morning I did a quick data analysis in Python/Jupyter: 1. read two datasets from an HDF5 file 2. perform a Fourier transform. 3. plot the Fourier transform. If I wanted to do that in Observable, I'd spend a lot more time figuring out how to read HDF5 files and how to do Fourier transforms in JavaScript than getting used to Observable. From that point of view, your tutorials are nice but only a small first step on the learning curve.
